Utterance: Hi! It’s great to see you again. How has your week been?
Hi, Ellie! I had a mix of days again. I tried painting, though!
That’s fantastic! How did it go?
It was really nice. I painted a sunset, and it felt good to be creative again.
That sounds beautiful! How did you feel while you were painting?
I felt peaceful and focused. It was a nice escape from everything else.
I’m so glad to hear that. It sounds like painting is a positive outlet for you. Did you notice any changes in your mood afterwards?
Yes, I felt lighter afterward. But then I had a couple of rough days again.
I appreciate your honesty. What do you think contributed to those rough days?
I think it was just the job search again. I got a couple of rejections, and it hit me hard.
Rejections can be really tough. How did you cope with those feelings?
I tried to remind myself that it’s part of the process, but it’s hard to stay positive.
It’s completely normal to feel discouraged. Have you thought about ways to celebrate the small wins, even in the job search?
I haven’t really. I guess I just focus on the negatives.
It might help to create a list of things you’re proud of, even if they’re small. Would you be willing to try that?
Yeah, I could do that.
Great! You could write down your accomplishments in painting, attending the art exhibit, and even the effort you put into job applications.
That makes sense. I’ll try to keep track of those.
I’m excited to hear how that goes. It’s important to acknowledge your efforts. Is there anything else you’d like to discuss today?
I’ve been thinking about my family a lot. I miss them.
Family can be a significant part of our lives. What specifically do you miss about them?
Just being around them, sharing moments. I wish I could see them more often.
It sounds like you value those connections. Have you considered setting up regular calls or video chats to stay in touch?
I haven’t thought about that. It could be nice to connect more often.
It could help bridge the distance and keep those relationships strong. Would you like to set a goal for that?
Yes, I could try to call them once a week.
That sounds like a wonderful goal. Let’s check in about how that goes in our next session.
Okay, I’ll do that.
I’m proud of you for taking these steps to connect with your family. Remember, it’s okay to feel a range of emotions during this time.
Thanks, Ellie. I appreciate your support.
You’re very welcome. I’m here for you. Let’s continue to work together on these goals.
Sounds good to me!
Great! I look forward to our next session. Take care!
Bye, Ellie!
